York University • Student-led • Est. 2024

HEART advocates for health equity.

HEART (Health Equity Advocacy Response Team) advances health equity by addressing systemic, social, and economic barriers through advocacy, education, outreach, and community partnerships.

Get involved Learn more
  • Community partnerships
  • Health education & workshops
  • Advocacy campaigns
Health equity Community action
Want updates? Follow us on Instagram @heart_yorku.

Our Mission

To advocate, educate, and act in response to health inequities by empowering communities, supporting evidence-based initiatives, and fostering inclusive healthcare systems.

Advocacy

Raise awareness about health disparities and support equity-focused change.

Education

Share evidence-based resources and promote accessible health learning.

Community Action

Partner with organizations and volunteer to reduce barriers to care.

What We Do

HEART turns awareness into action through outreach, education, advocacy, and collaboration.

Community engagement

Volunteer with local partners and support community-centered initiatives.

Research & awareness

Highlight inequities through data, storytelling, and student-led initiatives.

Workshops & resources

Deliver health education and share inclusive, accessible resources.

Advocacy campaigns

Promote equity-focused change and support marginalized communities.

Get involved

HEART welcomes students from all disciplines — public health, nursing, psychology, policy, sciences, arts, and more.

Join HEART View events Follow @heart_yorku
HEART

Health Equity Advocacy Response Team — a York University student-led group advancing health equity through advocacy, education, outreach, and community action.

This is a student-led website and is not an official York University website.
